reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.body:
Nothing to say about this machine
Best in every moment
Battery life is more enough good than iphone 16 or iphone 16 plus
Quality is much better
Look is more better in white colour
Heating issue occur after 1 hour of whatsapp video call
Hang issue not occur since

reviews.title: Good product
reviews.body: Good quality but i faced some heating issues while recording video in two days of usage.

reviews.title: Everything
reviews.body: Worth investing absolutely love the user friendly features, camera and video quality.

reviews.title: Buy Only if Coming from iPhone 13 or earlier
reviews.body:
Iâ€™ve upgraded from the iPhone 15 to the iPhone 16 Pro, and here are my thoughts:

Camera: The rear camera has noticeable improvements, offering better photo quality and enhanced details. However, the front camera remains the same as the iPhone 15.

Battery Life: No significant changes in battery performance compared to the iPhone 15.

Design & Build: The new titanium body feels premium and sturdy in hand.

Display: The screen is excellent, but when using a case, the difference in display quality between the iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 15 becomes less discernible.

If you own an iPhone 15, this upgrade may not offer enough to justify the switch. However, if you have an iPhone 13 or older, the iPhone 16 Pro is a substantial upgrade worth considering.

reviews.title: Smooth purchase, minor hiccups with the trade in.
reviews.body:
The delivery person seemed a little cranky and kinda rude through out the old phone trade-in process. The rest of the experience otherwise was great.
The package arrived in a good condition. I was skeptical about making a major purchase off of Amazon but phew, it just all happened without any issues.
Worth the upgrade if going from iPhone 13 or older, cause thereâ€™s a lot of changes from the previous slightly older models.
The battery initially seemed to be draining pretty fast, but once I updated the phone to the latest ios somehow the battery life got better. Not sure if itâ€™s with all the iPhones, just an observation from my side.

reviews.title: Great phone but poor customer service of seller
reviews.body: Its been almost 3 weeks and I am yet to get proper invoice from seller. The invoice do not carry any serial no. of phone and looks more of a scam. Please do not buy if seller cannot fix this basic thing.

reviews.title: A Sleek Upgrade Experience
reviews.body:
I was actually hesitant to order an iPhone from Amazon because there have been instances where the product wasnâ€™t genuine. However, I was finally relieved to see that the package was genuine, and the iPhone itself was the real deal. ðŸ˜‚

I ordered the black model, and the color is sleek. I love it! ðŸ–¤

If youâ€™re coming from an older iPhone model like the 13 Pro or earlier, or if youâ€™re new to the Apple ecosystem, this is a great upgrade. However, I donâ€™t think itâ€™s worth upgrading from an iPhone 15 Pro if youâ€™re a casual user. Thereâ€™s not much of a difference between the two, except that youâ€™ll be holding the latest iPhone. ðŸ˜‰

reviews.title: Best iPhone with pro camera button
reviews.body:
Itâ€™s good to upgrade. Battery life good till evening. Camera button is more useful if I set it for zooming.

Side button for silent mode is too close to volume button that, sometimes, pressed accidentally for increasing volume. Itâ€™ll take time to use to.

cons: Lack of significant battery performance improvement
Inconvenient placement of silent mode button
Limited difference from previous models for casual users
summary: The iPhone 16 Pro offers good battery life and high quality with user-friendly features.
The camera and video quality are improved, along with a premium design and build.
However, there are some issues with heating during video recording and the placement of the silent mode button.
Additionally, there have been problems with the invoice from the seller and limited upgrades for casual users.
Overall, the iPhone 16 Pro is a worthy upgrade for those coming from older models or new to the Apple ecosystem, but may not be worth it for casual users or those with recent models.
